description: Runs one or more SQL statements, which can be data manipulation language (DML) or data definition language (DDL). Depending on the authorization method, use one of the following combinations of request parameters: For more information about the Amazon Redshift Data API and CLI usage examples, see Using the Amazon Redshift Data API in the Amazon Redshift Management Guide.

parameters.name: ClientToken
parameters.description: A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

parameters.name: Sqls
parameters.description:
One or more SQL statements to run. The SQL statements are run as a single transaction. They run serially in the order of the array. Subsequent SQL statements don't start until the previous statement in the array completes. If any SQL statement fails, then because they are run as one transaction, all work is rolled back.

(string) ---

nested_items.name: ClusterIdentifier
nested_items.description: The cluster identifier. This element is not returned when connecting to a serverless workgroup.

nested_items.name: CreatedAt
nested_items.description: The date and time (UTC) the statement was created.

nested_items.name: DbGroups
nested_items.description: A list of colon (:) separated names of database groups.

nested_items.name: Id
nested_items.description: The identifier of the SQL statement whose results are to be fetched. This value is a universally unique identifier (UUID) generated by Amazon Redshift Data API. This identifier is returned by BatchExecuteStatment.

nested_items.name: SecretArn
nested_items.description: The name or ARN of the secret that enables access to the database.

nested_items.name: SessionId
nested_items.description: The session identifier of the query.

nested_items.name: WorkgroupName
nested_items.description: The serverless workgroup name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN). This element is not returned when connecting to a provisioned cluster.
